title: If you buff one top laner why not buff the others?
body:
Playing Shen laning Renekton his +Healing on champs is  QUITE noticeable. Funny how before the patch Shen stood a chance against him, now Renek has the edge. Why not buff Shen's sustain considering is you hardly see it when the other champs out DAMAGE you. Or you could buff Shen's dmg?

Wishful thinking.

replies.body: The light travels fast but the spotlight can never catch a ninja.

'Cause Renekton is supposed to be a counter to Shen, not vice-versa. Before, Shen would just press W, soak up a bunch of the damage, then dash, Q+AA, heal most of the damage back and out trade Ren in the process.

> [{quoted}](name=Zair Umbras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PdVMXElW,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-01-20T01:28:28.293+0000)
>
> 'Cause Renekton is supposed to be a counter to Shen, not vice-versa. Before, Shen would just press W, soak up a bunch of the damage, then dash, Q+AA, heal most of the damage back and out trade Ren in the process.


Well I guess shen has quite a few counters then? Gnar/Garen/Darius/Renekton/Fiora/Teemo/VLAD, all ranged magic dmg users. Tired of hearing this counter crap.

funny, never had prolems vs shen or any melee befor that patch, but the noticible reduced furry+heal from minions makes lifes much harder vs ranged and in clashes. While you gain more helath and fury for more enemy champs, you rarly can hit many at once if they don't suck hard at positioning. Healing and mostly gaining furry from creeps befor fights is significantly worse than before + fury decays faster, so it actually was a nerf to renekton overall, atleast for gold+.
Cause Shen ult's value is too great.
